title: (Pwn2Own) QNAP TS-464 Netmgr Endpoint CRLF Injection Arbitrary Configuration Update Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to create arbitrary configurations on affected installations of QNAP TS-464 NAS devices. An attacker must first obtain the ability to access the device's localhost interface, which can be accomplished using a malicious TURN server.
The specific flaw exists within the legacy_cgi endpoints. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before using it to update configurations. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to create arbitrary configurations on the system.
addtionnal_details: QNAP has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.qnap.com/en/security-advisory/qsa-24-09
timeline:
2023-11-15 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2024-05-19 - Coordinated public release of advisory
